content.prompt: Whenever the production of a good creates negative externalities, an unregulated market will result in

choices.label: too little of the good being produced
an optimal amount of the good being produced as long as the market is perfectly competitive
society's marginal cost being higher than the firm's marginal cost
the firm's marginal cost being higher than society's marginal cost
the firm's marginal cost being equal to society's marginal cost
